scriptureVerse.verse: Let no one despise you for your youth, but set the believers an example in speech, in conduct, in love, in faith, in purity. Until I come, devote yourself to the public reading of Scripture, to exhortation, to teaching.

body: Logos Student Ministries desires to see students grow in the word of God while being intentional about living out the truth of the word of God. We want to be a community of people that provide the freedom to wrestle with the text while cultivating and facilitating the spiritual growth and development of our students. We want to see every student in Logos Student Ministries grow in their reliance of scripture, while operating in an attitude of service, as they grow in grace in a lifestyle of true Gospel witness.

faq.question: What's the best way to get my student plugged into Logos Student Ministry?
faq.answer: We have an amazing team of small group leaders who are ready and excited to welcome your student into our gathering space also known as the FlexRoom. We will help your student be immersed into the Logos culture and environment while at the very same time helping them feel right at home. We gather together every Tuesday from 6:30pm-8:30pm.

faq.question: As a parent, can I come check out Logos Student Ministry?
faq.answer: As a Student Ministry we believe in the full safety and security of our students in our space. Each Small Group leader and adult present in the FlexRoom during a Logos Gathering, has to take a background check prior to being in our space. However, if you want to come and check out our gathering space, please connect with the Youth Ministry Director or email wesley.livingston@vbvf.org so that a member on our team can host you on that day.

faq.question: Where does Logos Student Ministry meet?
faq.answer: We meet every Tuesday in the FlexRoom at Verse by Verse Fellowship ( 551 E Nakoma Dr, San Antonio, TX 78216) from 6:30pm - 8:30pm.

faq.question: What's the best way to get updates on what is happening in Passion Students?
faq.answer: The best way to receive updates from out Team is by signing up on our email list. Scroll to the bottom of this page and sign-up for more information and to start receiving updates. Our team will be sending out weekly digital newsletters that will detail the upcoming news and need-to know for the week.

faq.question: How do I become a youth leader within Logos Student Ministry
faq.answer: Currently, our team has an amazing group of small group leaders and we are not adding any additional small group leaders at this time. If opportunities to serve become available in the future, please fill out the form below so that we can have your information on file to fill you in on any updates and availability for volunteering with the Team.

faq.question: How do I get in touch with the Logos Student Ministry team?
faq.answer: The best way to get in touch with our team is to fill out the email form below or email Wesley Livingston ,Youth Ministry Director, at wesley.livingston@vbvf.org with any questions you may have.

leader.name: Wesley Livingston
leader.bio: In addition to serving as the Youth Ministry Director, Wesley serves as a teacher in San Antonio ISD (SAISD), an inner-city school district. He is passionate about people and developing leaders into transforming agents of change to the Glory of God. He believes that as followers of Christ, we can best impact our world by living out transformed lives by being effectual doers of the word and not by simply being hearers that delude themselves.
